main.name: Ryan Stocks
main.description: , currently employed part time by Penten and the ANU where I live, breathe, and teach the art of code and optimization.
main.bio: I am currently undertaking my fourth year of a Bachelor of Philosophy degree at the Australian National University majoring in computer science with a strong interest in High-Performance Computing. I have liked working at the interface of computing and the physical sciences and enjoy the occasional maths problem. In my spare time I can often be found tinkering with various projects (such as this one) or running/adventuring in the bush.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to reach out anytime by email or phone

resume.skillmessage: I am proficient in numerous programming languages, in particular python and C/C++, with additional experience using ARM Assembly, Ada, Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Haskell, Q# and Bash. I also have significant experience using high performance computing (HPC) infrastructure and massively parallel systems using programming models including MPI and OpenMP. I have experience optimizing software for many-GPU hardware using low level libraries such as CUDA. In addition I make extensive use of version control systems such as git including continuous integration and project management tools such as Jira and Confluence.

education.description:
Major in computer science with minors in Physics and Mathematics.
GPA 7.0/7.0
Dean’s Science Education Commendation Award.
College dux with subject awards (highest mark) in Specialist Maths, Specialist Methods, Physics, IT (Programming) and Technical Theatre

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Working with the Applied AI group at Penten developing advanced cyber deception tools and software. This includes using natural language processing (NLP) techniques and GPT-2 to generate fake documents (honey files) and deception agents/services.

work.title: Computer Science Tutor and Computing Research Assistant
work.description:
I have tutored a variety of university computing courses including: 
• COMP1100/1130 — Programming as problem solving
• COMP1110/1140 — Structured Programming
• COMP2300 — Computer organisation and program execution
• COMP3320 — High Performance Scientific Computing
• COMP3600 — Algorithms
• COMP3620 — Artificial Intelligence
• COMP4300 — Parallel Systems

In addition I have worked as a research assistant on multiple projects developing code for a global search of pumped hydro energy storage sites and developing algorithms to control a swarm of UAVs for lightning strike ignition detection and suppression as part of the ANU Bushfire Initiative

Publications.name: Enabling large-scale correlated electronic structure calculations: scaling the RI-MP2 method on summit
Publications.description: Giuseppe MJ Barca et. al. 33rd International Conference for High Performance Computing, Networking, Storage and Analysis: Science and Beyond, SC 2021.

projects.title: Global pumped hydro energy storage search
projects.category: High performance software developed for the search of potential PHES sites around the world

testimonials.text: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
